Statistical Operations¶

Automatic Thresholder¶

class bayesflare.stats.thresholding.Thresholder(B, confidence=0.999)[source]¶

Class to carry out the thresholding proceedure in an automated manner.

Parameters:

B : ndarray

An array of log-odds ratios.

confidence : float, optional

The threshold confidence (percentage). Defaults to 0.999 (i.e. 99.9%).

Methods

bayes_to_confidence(lnB) This function returns a percentage confidence when given a lnB value.
calculate_threshold() This function returns the lnB above which a value has a 99.9% confidence of being a flare as opposed to guassian noise.
generate_threshold() This function generates a histogram to calculate the lnB values at a given confidence level.
bayes_to_confidence(lnB)[source]¶

This function returns a percentage confidence when given a lnB value.

Parameters:

quarter : int

The Kepler quarter from which the data is taken

cadence : string

The cadence of the data, can be either ‘long’ or ‘short’.

lnB : float

The ln(bayes factor) to be converted into a percentage conidence.
Returns:

percentage : float

The percentage confidence corresponding to lnB
calculate_threshold()[source]¶

This function returns the lnB above which a value has a 99.9% confidence of being a flare as opposed to guassian noise.

Parameters:

quarter : int

The Kepler quarter from which the data is taken

cadence : string

The cadence of the data, can be either ‘long’ or ‘short’.

confidence : float

The level of confidence where the threshold should be drawn. Default is 0.999
Returns:

threshold : float

the threshold ln(bayes factor) above which detections have confidence confidence of being a flare.
generate_threshold()[source]¶

This function generates a histogram to calculate the lnB values at a given confidence level. The histogram is then stored in the threshold folder.
